title.narrative: Goualougo Triangle Ape Project: Empowering Congolese Students to Strengthen the Link between Applied Research and Conservation Policy

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to improve the long-term conservation of great apes in the Republic of Congo by increasing local capacity and professional development. Provide advanced training in applied conservation research and facilitate opportunities for GTAP staff to link this information directly to conservation policy; promote leadership of GTAP staff in great ape health monitoring initiatives, including training in new technologies for data collection and expansion of worker health programs; implement a mentoring program which prepares research assistants to increase their participation in local, regional and international conservation advocacy; involve GTAP’s research staff in enhanced surveillance and monitoring activities (such as SMART) to protect at-risk ape populations along the southeast border of the NNNP.

description.narrative: U.S. assistance to the Republic of the Congo (Congo) focuses on promoting regional peace and security in this post-conflict country. Boasting Central Africa's only deep water port, the Congo's financial capital of Pointe-Noire maintains its International Ship and Port Facility Security (ISPS) certification. This certification creates significant economic opportunity for the Congo - which seeks to turn the coastal city into a regional shipping hub - while requiring a modern, professional security posture in accordance with strict ISPS standards. To help promote this growth and encourage regional stability, U.S. foreign assistance focuses on development of the Congo's professional military capabilities and provides foundational training for development in this area, in keeping with post's Integrated Country Strategy.
